description: Navigation-specific terminology for app frame and navigation components

values.label: Side Navigation
values.description: A navigation panel typically positioned on the left side of an application

definition.description: A vertical panel containing navigation items, typically positioned on the left side of an application interface
essentialCharacteristics: Provides persistent or collapsible access to main application sections
Can be resizable with drag functionality
Contains hierarchical navigation items
May include a state control (hamburger menu) to show/hide labels

values.label: Side Navigation Item
values.description: An individual item within side navigation

definition.description: A clickable item within side navigation that represents a destination or section in the application
essentialCharacteristics: Can be selected to indicate current location
Supports interaction states (default, hover, down, keyboard focus, disabled, selected, dragged, error)
May include an icon and label
Label may be hidden when side navigation is minimized

values.label: Header
values.description: The top bar of an application frame

definition.description: A horizontal bar at the top of an application that contains branding, navigation, and utility functions
essentialCharacteristics: Spans the full width of the application
May contain header navigation items
Typically includes application branding or title
May include utility controls (search, settings, user profile)

values.label: Header Navigation Item
values.description: An individual navigation item within the header

definition.description: A clickable item within the header that represents a destination or action
essentialCharacteristics: Positioned horizontally within the header
Can be selected to indicate current location
Supports interaction states (default, hover, down, keyboard focus, disabled, selected)
Typically more compact than side navigation items

values.label: Navigation Item
values.description: A generic term for clickable navigation elements

definition.description: A clickable element that allows users to navigate to different sections or pages within an application
essentialCharacteristics: Provides a destination or target location
Can be selected to show current location
Supports standard interaction states
May be part of various navigation patterns (side, top, breadcrumb, etc.)

terminology.namingRationale: Generic term used across all navigation contexts in Spectrum

values.label: Drag Area
values.description: An area that can be dragged to resize the side navigation panel

definition.description: A focusable area along the edge of the side navigation panel that allows users to resize the panel width
essentialCharacteristics: Smaller when a scrollbar is present
Focusable for keyboard interactions
Meets WCAG 2.5.8 target size requirements via alternate method (hamburger icon)
Enables resizing as alternative to dragging (WCAG 2.5.7)

sources.reference: App frame (browsing) CRD - Dragging accessibility notes

values.label: State Control
values.description: A control to show/hide side navigation labels or minimize/maximize the panel

definition.description: A button control, typically represented by a hamburger icon, that toggles the visibility of side navigation labels or the panel size
essentialCharacteristics: Provides alternate method for resizing (accessibility requirement)
Label changes based on state (e.g., 'Hide menu labels' when expanded)
Supports standard interaction states (default, hover, down, keyboard focus, disabled)
Ensures keyboard users can resize the panel

terminology.namingRationale: Named for its function (controlling state) rather than appearance (hamburger)
